counterSet.name: SQL Server 2017 XTP Transactions
counterSet.description: The XTP Transactions performance object contains counters related to XTP engine transactions in SQL Server.

counter.name: Transactions created/sec
counter.description: The number of transactions created in the system (on average), per second.

counter.name: Read-only transactions prepared/sec
counter.description: The number of read-only transactions that were prepared for commit processing, per second.

counter.name: Transactions aborted/sec
counter.description: The number of transactions that aborted (both by the user and the system, on average), per second.

counter.name: Transactions aborted by user/sec
counter.description: The number of transactions that were aborted by the user (on average), per second.

counter.name: Transaction validation failures/sec
counter.description: The number of transactions that failed validation processing (on average), per second.

counter.name: Commit dependencies taken/sec
counter.description: The number of commit dependencies taken by transactions (on average), per second.

counter.name: Cascading aborts/sec
counter.description: The number of transactions that rolled back to due a commit dependency rollback (on average), per second.

counter.name: Save points created/sec
counter.description: The number of save points created (on average), per second.

counter.name: Save point rollbacks/sec
counter.description: The number of times a transaction rolled back to a save point (on average), per second.

counter.name: Save point refreshes/sec
counter.description: The number of times a savepoint was ""refreshed"", (on average), per second. A savepoint refresh is when an existing savepoint is reset to the current point in the transaction's lifetime.

counterSet.name: SQL Server 2017 XTP Transaction Log
counterSet.description: The XTP Transaction Log performance object contains counters related to XTP transaction logging in SQL Server.

counter.name: Log bytes written/sec
counter.description: The number of bytes written to the SQL Server transaction log by the XTP engine (on average), per second.

counter.name: Log records written/sec
counter.description: The number of records written to the SQL Server transaction log by the XTP engine (on average), per second.

counterSet.name: SQL Server 2017 XTP Cursors
counterSet.description: The XTP Cursors performance object contains counters related to internal XTP engine cursors. Cursors are the low-level building blocks the XTP engine uses to process T-SQL queries. As such, a user does not typically have direct control over them.

counter.name: Cursor scans started/sec
counter.description: The number of cursor scans started (on average), per second.

counter.name: Rows returned/sec
counter.description: The number of rows returned by cursors (on average), per second.

counter.name: Rows touched/sec
counter.description: The number of rows touched by cursors (on average), per second.

counter.name: Tentatively-deleted rows touched/sec
counter.description: The number of expiring rows touched by cursors (on average), per second. A row is expiring if the transaction that deleted it is still active (i.e. has not yet committed or aborted.)

counter.name: Expired rows touched/sec
counter.description: The number of expired rows touched by cursors (on average), per second.

counter.name: Expired rows removed/sec
counter.description: The number of expired rows removed by cursors (on average), per second.

counter.name: Dusty corner scan retries/sec (user-issued)
counter.description: The number of scan retries due to write conflicts during dusty corner sweeps issued by a user's full-table scan (on average), per second. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: Cursor write conflicts/sec
counter.description: The number of write-write conflicts to the same row version (on average), per second.

counter.name: Cursor unique violations/sec
counter.description: The number of unique-constraint violations (on average), per second.

counter.name: Cursor inserts/sec
counter.description: The number of cursor inserts (on average), per second.

counter.name: Cursor updates/sec
counter.description: The number of cursor updates (on average), per second.

counter.name: Cursor deletes/sec
counter.description: The number of cursor deletes (on average), per second.

counterSet.name: SQL Server 2017 XTP Garbage Collection
counterSet.description: The XTP Garbage Collection performance object contains counters related to the XTP engine's garbage collector.

counter.name: Rows processed/sec
counter.description: The number of rows processed by the garbage collector (on average), per second.

counter.name: Rows processed/sec (no sweep needed)
counter.description: The number of rows processed by the garbage collector that will not require a dusty corner sweep (on average), per second.

counter.name: Rows processed/sec (first in bucket)
counter.description: The number of rows processed by the garbage collector that were first in the corresponding hash bucket (on average), per second.

counter.name: Rows processed/sec (first in bucket and removed)
counter.description: The number of rows processed by the garbage collector that were first in the corresponding hash bucket, and were able to be removed immediately (on average), per second.

counter.name: Rows processed/sec (marked for unlink)
counter.description: The number of rows processed by the garbage collector that were already marked for unlink (on average), per second.

counter.name: Parallel GC work item/sec
counter.description: The number of times a parallel thread has executed a GC work item.

counter.name: Main GC work items/sec
counter.description: The number of work items processed by the main GC thread.

counter.name: Sweep scans started/sec
counter.description: The number of dusty corner sweep scans started (on average), per second.

counter.name: Sweep rows touched/sec
counter.description: The number of rows touched during dusty corner sweeps (on average), per second.

counter.name: Sweep expiring rows touched/sec
counter.description: The number of expiring rows touched during dusty corner sweeps (on average), per second.

counter.name: Sweep expired rows touched/sec
counter.description: The number of expired rows touched during dusty corner sweeps (on average), per second.

counter.name: Sweep expired rows removed/sec
counter.description: The number of expired rows removed during dusty corner sweeps (on average), per second.

counter.name: Dusty corner scan retries/sec (GC-issued)
counter.description: The number of scan retries due to write conflicts during dusty corner sweeps issued by the garbage collector (on average), per second. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counterSet.name: SQL Server 2017 XTP Phantom Processor
counterSet.description: The XTP Phantom Processor performance object contains counters related to the XTP engine's phantom processing subsystem. This component is responsible for detecting phantom rows in transactions running at the SERIALIZABLE isolation level.

counter.name: Phantom scans started/sec
counter.description: The number of phantom scans started (on average), per second.

counter.name: Phantom rows touched/sec
counter.description: The number of rows touched by phantom scans (on average), per second.

counter.name: Phantom expiring rows touched/sec
counter.description: The number of expiring rows touched by phantom scans (on average), per second.

counter.name: Phantom expired rows touched/sec
counter.description: The number of expired rows touched by phantom scans (on average), per second.

counter.name: Phantom expired rows removed/sec
counter.description: The number of expired rows removed by phantom scans (on average), per second.

counter.name: Dusty corner scan retries/sec (Phantom-issued)
counter.description: The number of scan retries due to write conflicts during dusty corner sweeps issued by the phantom processor (on average), per second. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counterSet.name: SQL Server 2017 XTP Storage
counterSet.description: The XTP Storage performance object contains counters related to the XTP engine's storage subsystem. This includes checkpointing and merge of checkpoint files.

counter.name: Merge Requests Outstanding
counter.description: The number of merge requests outstanding since the server started.

counter.name: Merge Policy Evaluations
counter.description: The number of merge policy evaluations since the server started.

counter.name: Merges Installed
counter.description: The number of merges successfully installed.

counter.name: Merges Abandoned
counter.description: The number of merges abandoned due to failure.

counter.name: Core Merges Completed
counter.description: The number of core merges completed by the merge worker thread. These merges still need to be installed.

counter.name: Total Files Merged
counter.description: The total number of source files merged. This count can be used to find the average number of source files in the merge

counter.name: Checkpoints Completed
counter.description: Count of checkpoints processed by offline checkpoint thread

counter.name: Checkpoints Closed
counter.description: Count of checkpoints closed done by online agent

counterSet.name: SQL Server 2017 XTP IO Governor
counterSet.description: The XTP IO Governor performance object contains counters related to the XTP IO Rate Governor.

counter.name: Log Blocks/sec
counter.description: Number of log blocks processed by controller per second.

counter.name: Io Issued/sec
counter.description: Number of Io issued per second by flush threads.

counter.name: Stale Rate Object Waits/sec
counter.description: Number of waits due to stale rate objects (per second).

counter.name: Insufficient Credits Waits/sec
counter.description: Number of waits due to insufficient credits in the rate objects (per second).

counter.name: Missed Credit Slots
counter.description: Number of credit slots missed because of wait for credits from rate object.

counter.name: Total Rate Objects Published
counter.description: Total number of Rate objects published.

counter.name: IoPagePool4K Total Allocated
counter.description: Total number of pages allocated and held by the 4K IO page pool from the backend allocator. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: IoPagePool4K Free List Count
counter.description: Number of pages in the the 4K IO page pool free list. If this value goes to zero, more pages are allocated from the backend allocator. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: IoPagePool64K Total Allocated
counter.description: Total number of pages allocated and held by the 64K IO page pool from the backend allocator. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: IoPagePool64K Free List Count
counter.description: Number of pages in the the 64K IO page pool free list. If this value goes to zero, more pages are allocated from the backend allocator. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: IoPagePool256K Total Allocated
counter.description: Total number of pages allocated and held by the 256K IO page pool from the backend allocator. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: IoPagePool256K Free List Count
counter.description: Number of pages in the the 256K IO page pool free list. If this value goes to zero, more pages are allocated from the backend allocator. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: Tail Cache Page Count
counter.description: Number of pages allocated in the Tail Cache. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: Tail Cache Page Count Peak
counter.description: Highest number of pages allocated in the Tail Cache. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: Tx Segment Avg Size Base
counter.description: Base for AvgTxSegmentSize. Not displayed.

counter.name: Avg Transaction Segment Size
counter.description: Average size of transaction segment payload. If this value goes to zero, more pages are allocated from the backend allocator. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: MtLog 4K Page Fill % Base
counter.description: Base for MtLog4KPageFillPctPerPageFlush. Not displayed.

counter.name: MtLog 4K Page Fill %/Page Flushed
counter.description: Average fill percentage of each 4K MtLog page flushed. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: MtLog 64K Page Fill % Base
counter.description: Base for MtLog4KPageFillPctPerPageFlush. Not displayed.

counter.name: MtLog 64K Page Fill %/Page Flushed
counter.description: Average fill percentage of each 64K MtLog page flushed. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: MtLog 256K Page Fill % Base
counter.description: Base for MtLog4KPageFillPctPerPageFlush. Not displayed.

counter.name: MtLog 256K Page Fill %/Page Flushed
counter.description: Average fill percentage of each 256K MtLog page flushed. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: MtLog 4K Expand Count
counter.description: Number of times a 4K MtLog was expanded. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: MtLog 64K Expand Count
counter.description: Number of times a 64K MtLog was expanded. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: MtLog 256K Expand Count
counter.description: Number of times a 256K MtLog was expanded. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: MtLog 4K Write Bytes/sec
counter.description: Write bytes per second on 4K MtLog objects. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: MtLog 64K Write Bytes/sec
counter.description: Write bytes per second on 64K MtLog objects. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: MtLog 256K Write Bytes/sec
counter.description: Write bytes per second on 256K MtLog objects. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: Flush Thread 4K Queue Depth
counter.description: Flush Thread queue depth for 4K IO requests.

counter.name: Flush Thread 64K Queue Depth
counter.description: Flush Thread queue depth for 64K IO requests.

counter.name: Flush Thread 256K Queue Depth
counter.description: Flush Thread queue depth for 256K IO requests.

counter.name: Flush Thread Frozen IOs/sec (4K)
counter.description: The number of 4K IO requests encountered during flush page processing that are above the freeze threshold and thus cannot be issued.

counter.name: Flush Thread Frozen IOs/sec (64K)
counter.description: The number of 64K IO requests encountered during flush page processing that are above the freeze threshold and thus cannot be issued.

counter.name: Flush Thread Frozen IOs/sec (256K)
counter.description: The number of 256K IO requests encountered during flush page processing that are above the freeze threshold and thus cannot be issued.

counter.name: Num Serializations
counter.description: The number of serializations in flight.

counter.name: Num Serializations/sec
counter.description: The number of serializations created per second (on average).

counter.name: Num Merges
counter.description: The number of merges in flight.

counter.name: Num Merges/sec
counter.description: The number of merges created per second (on average).

counter.name: MtLog 4K IOs Outstanding
counter.description: The number of outstanding 4K IO requests issued by MtLog.

counter.name: MtLog 64K IOs Outstanding
counter.description: The number of outstanding 64K IO requests issued by MtLog.

counter.name: MtLog 256K IOs Outstanding
counter.description: The number of outstanding 256K IO requests issued by MtLog.

counter.name: Avg Transaction Segment Large Data Size
counter.description: Average size of transaction segment large data payload. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.

counter.name: Redo Log Processed Bytes/sec
counter.description: Log bytes per second that Redo controller has processed.

counter.name: Redo Active Workers
counter.description: The number of active redo workers.

counter.name: Redo Segment Definition/Sec
counter.description: The number segments definitions seen per second. This is a very low-level counter, not intended for customer use.
